intro: Spermacoce oldenlandiae, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique flowering pattern and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
